Todd Park, my boss, recruited

734.09.text: And we'll talk a bit about that.

But first I want to

737.47.text:
been asked so many times,
which is why did the site fail?

740.92.text:
Most people believe that--
from outside the tech industry,

746.04.text:
the question I

747.88.text:
how could it have
possibly failed?

751.14.text:
It must have been underfunded
and under-planned.

754.75.text:
It was absolutely
neither of those things.

756.97.text:
It was over-funded and
it was over-planned.

759.01.text:
And when I say
"planned," I mean this.

761.28.text:
And I will not lecture
to a Google crowd

763.33.text:
about the challenges of
waterfall development.

767.84.text:
This is standard operating
procedure in government,

770.89.text:
that we do all of the
planning up front.

773.44.text:
And when we do that--
Clay Shirky had

775.69.text:
a great line about
this-- actually he and I

778.10.text: talked a lot during the year.

779.37.text:
And he wrote up an article
in "Foreign Affairs" where

781.94.text:
he explained that the waterfall
method amounts by a pledge,

785.30.text:
to a pledge by all parties,
not to learn anything

790.67.text:
Waterfall method is
what we do in DC,

793.97.text:
not just because it's
what's comfortable there,

797.40.text:
but because we have a
culture of legislation.

800.45.text:
It's sort of as if you wrote
the rules around search quality

805.60.text:
or spam control once--
when Google started,

808.70.text:
and it was written
into legislation.

810.51.text:
In order to change how you
interact with your users,

813.54.text: you had to go to Congress.

815.18.text:
It's a very fundamental,
difficult problem.

818.90.text:
But it is rooted not just in
the fact that we run the country

822.44.text:
through legislation, but
through a culture that

824.40.text:
assumes the things
get written once,

828.17.text:
So we do all of our
planning, and then we

830.15.text:
execute to that plan,
whether it's working or not.

832.39.text:
And it certainly
was not working.

834.53.text:
The other reason that we
do government technology

841.00.text:
is that we have this thing
called the Federal Acquisition

844.90.text:
It is something like
2,600 pages long.

848.44.text:
And it's the regulation
that tells us

850.38.text:
how we buy things in

And it says a lot

859.07.text:
about-- if you think about

861.63.text:
you want to know what you were

864.55.text:
So that has been

866.26.text:
must know everything

868.40.text:
to do before we have any

871.93.text:
which of course is going to

876.62.text:

879.28.text:
to what many think is about a
94% failure rate in federal IT.

886.80.text:
I know that sounds

889.86.text:

that did work, but

894.20.text:
more than any confident

And the ones that are successes

912.16.text:
